data.name: HelpDontShow
data.value: Don't show again

data.name: HelpShowhelpagain
data.value: You can show this help at any time by clicking {0} at the foot of the page

data.name: HelpString
data.value: Help

data.name: HelpWelcome
data.value: Welcome to Langademy!

data.name: LangademyState
data.value: Langademy state

data.name: ChatRoomsIntro
data.value: The chat rooms are the place where you can go to exchange languages with a native. Select a room in your right panel and start practicing your favourite language! Remember that you can check the meetup board to know when the chat room meetups take place.

data.name: TimeBankDescription
data.value: Time banking founds the mechanics that assures that language exchanges are fair for everyone at Langademy. It means that if you make a timebanking video call with a native speaker, you must contribute the same time speaking in your native language, with the same or other students. Langademy records video call durations so you don't have to worry about the math. Just watch your time balance ({0}) to decide if you need to schedule video calls in your native language and increase your time balance. This is how timebanking works:

data.name: TimeBankF1
data.value: When you sign up at Langademy you begin with 30 minutes in your Time Bank account so you can practice the language you want.

data.name: TimeBankF2
data.value: By default, you will not be able to accumulate more than 10 hours in your Time Bank account.

data.name: TimeBankF3
data.value: Invite your friends and you will get 30 extra minutes for each friend that signs up with your invitation. You can also earn hours for your Time Bank account by following Langademy on Twitter and Facebook (+ 30 minutes).

data.name: TimeBankF4
data.value: When you make a timebanking video call ({0}) in a language that is not your native language, you spend time from your Time Bank account. However, if you make a video call to a non-native in your native language (minimum level: C2), the call time will be added to your account.

data.name: TimeBankF5
data.value: Calls that are shorter than a minute will neither add or subtract time from your account

data.name: TimeBankTitle
data.value: Time Bank

data.name: HelpChatRoom
data.value: Chat Rooms

data.name: WalletTitle
data.value: Wallet

data.name: HelpIndex
data.value: Index

data.name: HelpGeneralTitle
data.value: How does Langademy work?

data.name: HelpGoToIndex
data.value: Return to index

data.name: HelpLangademyStateTitle
data.value: Langademy state

data.name: HelpLearnersTitle
data.value: Learners: how to start

data.name: HelpLangademyFeeTitle
data.value: Langademy fee. How it works

data.name: HelpNativesSent1
data.value: If you want to earn money making wallet video calls in your native language, you have to meet some requirements.

data.name: HelpNativesSent3
data.value: You need to have a minimum number of up votes in a language if you want to set a rate for that language. Make free wallet video calls or time banking calls with other language learners and gain positive up votes. Once you gain the required number of positive votes in a certain language, you will be able to set your rate for that language.

data.name: HelpNativesSent4
data.value: Fill your {0}.

data.name: HelpNativesSent5
data.value: Once you meet these two requirements, you are ready to set a rate and earn money with Wallet calls.

data.name: HelpNativesTitle
data.value: Native speakers: how to start

data.name: HelpTBIntroTitle
data.value: Time Banking introduction

data.name: HelpChatRoomsTitle
data.value: Chat rooms

data.name: HelpTBWorkTitle
data.value: Time banking rules

data.name: HelpWalletIntroTitle
data.value: My Wallet

data.name: HelpWalletRoomsTitle
data.value: Wallet video calls introduction

data.name: HelpWithdrawalTitle
data.value: Credit withdrawal

data.name: HelpRelatedArticles
data.value: Related articles

data.name: HelpState1
data.value: You can change your state from your home screen. Click your avatar and the State Panel will be opened.

data.name: HelpState2
data.value: Once there, you have different options regarding your state:

data.name: HelpState3
data.value: If you don’t want to receive any calls, just set your state to busy

data.name: HelpState4
data.value: Time Banking calls: If you want to use time banking calls, you can set 2 states. With the first state, you can select if you want to receive time banking calls in a specific language. The second state lets you switch on and off the automatic partner finder. If you disable the overall state of a language, the automatic partner finder will also be disabled.

data.name: HelpState5
data.value: Wallet calls: Disable the languages that you don’t want to receive Wallet calls.

data.name: HelpState6
data.value: Automatic partner finder

data.name: HelpState7
data.value: Langademy will find you an online partner that meets your preferences and that is available to speak with you. When a match is found, you will receive a notification asking if you want to start a call with the chosen partner.

data.name: HelpStudentIntro1
data.value: Language learners have two options if they want to practice a language: they can make either Wallet calls or Time Banking calls.

data.name: HelpStudentIntro2
data.value: In a Wallet call, language learners pay in order to have a conversation with a native. If a time banking call is made, time is used as a trade. Check the {0} and the {1} sections for more information about these type of calls.

data.name: HelpStudentIntro3
data.value: When you meet new partners in a room, you can send them a connection request. Once you are connected, you will be able to make video calls without entering the rooms.

data.name: HelpTBIntro1
data.value: Time Banking allows yo to learn languages in Langademy without spending money: the amount of time you use for speaking with other language learners in your native language will be added to your Time Banking account so you can use it making video calls in other languages. Check the Time Banking rules ({0}).

data.name: HelpTBIntro2
data.value: In your home page, you can check your Time Banking account balance, and if you go to the {0} app you will see the history and details of your Time Banking account.

data.name: HelpChatRooms1
data.value: Chat rooms are the place where you can meet groups of conversation partners, both natives and students. First of all you have to add in your profile the languages you are interested on. Otherwise you will not have access to the chat rooms. Once done, go to the control panel, click and select the language chat room to open it.

data.name: HelpChatRooms4
data.value: Users: It contains the list of online users. Click the users on the list to open a menu with these options: send a contact request, start a video call, and report or block the user.

data.name: HelpChatRooms7
data.value: If the room is empty or there is no activity at the moment, you can create Meetups to tell the others when you will be free to have a chat or a video call. You can also join the existing meetups.

data.name: HelpTBRooms4
data.value: Creating meetups in the Meetup Board

data.name: HelpTBRooms5
data.value: On the other hand, if you are attending a meetup, you can propose new topics for the meetup or vote the topics that other users have proposed.

data.name: HelpTBRooms6
data.value: You can go to the Meetup Board from your chat room or from your home page. Once there, you will see all the meetups that are scheduled in the languages that you have in your profile. If you want to create a new meetup, select a language, day and time of the meetup and create the meetup. Once a meetup is created, you can invite your Langademy contacts to it.

data.name: HelpWalletFees1
data.value: Langademy charges native speakers 13% (+ taxes) of the amount that they charge students per Wallet video call. Once the video call is finished, users' available credit balance is updated. (You can watch your available balance at {0}) ( {1})

data.name: HelpWalletFees2
data.value: The Available Credits Balance represents the current amount of credits that you can spend. In order to understand how it is calculated, several terms need to be explained:

data.name: HelpWalletFees3
data.value: Total Balance: it shows the total amount of credits before the 13% fee is applied to it.

data.name: HelpWalletFees4
data.value: Langademy fee: at the end of the month, Langademy collects a 13% fee to the conversations of the native speakers. This fee is reflected on the next invoice ({0}). Although the fee is not taken from the native’s account until the invoice is issued, this amount is withheld and you cannot spend it either.

data.name: HelpWalletFees5
data.value: Pending withdrawal requests: If a credit withdrawal is requested, the amount of credits that has been requested won't be available to spend it.

data.name: HelpWalletFees6
data.value: Available balance: In the view of the abovementioned terms, this is how the available balance is calculated

data.name: HelpWalletFees7
data.value: Available balance = Total balance – Langademy fee – Amount of credits requested for withdrawal

data.name: HelpWalletWithdrawal1
data.value: Credit withdrawal can be requested in My Wallet -> Withdrawals

data.name: HelpWalletWithdrawal2
data.value: Credit Withdrawals are processed every 15 days. If you want, you can edit the amount of credits you have requested before the processing of the withdrawal has begun. Once the request has been done, you can’t make another request until the previous request has been processed.

data.name: HelpWCIntro1
data.value: Wallet video calls are for those who do not have time for time banking and want to practice languages with native speakers.

data.name: HelpWCR2
data.value: Requirements to make Wallet calls

data.name: HelpWCR3
data.value: Native speakers have to meet some requirements in order to start earning money with Wallet calls.

data.name: HelpWCR4
data.value: Requirements for language learners:

data.name: HelpWCR5
data.value: Chatting in the Wallet rooms it’s free. However, language learners have to buy credits if they want have access to the wallet rooms. Once they have made a purchase, they can chat and make video calls with native speakers. During a call, the rate that have been specified by the native speaker will be applied to the call

data.name: HelpWCR6
data.value: Requirements for native speakers:

data.name: HelpWCR7
data.value: When native speakers join a room, they won't be able to set a Wallet rate, and therefore to earn money with the calls. Firstly, they need to meet the following requirements:

data.name: HelpWCR8
data.value: Each language requires having a minimum number of positive votes. In order to gain positive votes, native speakers have to make calls in that language with language learners. They can make free (a 0-credits rate) or time banking calls. If a native speaker wants to gather learners at a certain date and time, they can create meetups. More info at {0}

data.name: HelpWCR9
data.value: Complete the billing address: Go to My Wallet and complete the billing address.

data.name: HelpWalletIntro1
data.value: My Wallet is the app where you can manage your finances at Langademy. In this app you can check your transactions, invoicing history and add or edit your invoicing data. You can also purchase credits an request credit withdrawals from My Wallet.

data.name: HelpWalletIntro2
data.value: You can open My Wallet app clicking the Apps button at the Control Panel and selecting the My Wallet button

data.name: HelpHeaderTitle
data.value: Langademy Help

data.name: HelpIndexTitle
data.value: How can we help you?

data.name: HelpNativesSent6
data.value: Introduction to Wallet rooms and calls

data.name: HelpNativesSent7
data.value: When you have the minimum reputation required for a certaing language, you will have to specify a rate for your calls. Once you are in a room, you can chat with the language learners while you wait someone to call you. If you have a good reputation and you make a good impression in the chat room, it will be easier to receive calls.

data.name: HelpNativesSent8
data.value: When you receive a video call, your rate will be applied to the call and your Wallet credit balance will be updated once the call is finished. Each call will have a fee ({0}) that will be charged to your account at the end of the month.

data.name: HelpCheckPrices
data.value: check prices

data.name: HelpCalendarTitle
data.value: Langademy calendar

data.name: HelpCompleteProfile1
data.value: The main reason to complete your profile is to help you contact with students easily and to ensure that you appear in search results. Completing your profile will attract more students' attention and you will have more conversation requests.

data.name: HelpCompleteProfile2
data.value: You can upload your profile photo and a cover photo. You should also include your gender, age and country, and a brief overview about you.

data.name: HelpCompleteProfile3
data.value: You must also add the languages you speak and/or learn. When you add a language you must set your level, meaning:

data.name: HelpCompleteProfileTitle
data.value: Why you should complete your profile

data.name: HelpProfileTitle
data.value: Langademy profile

data.name: HelpSetAvailability1
data.value: You set your availability in your calendar in order to restrict the dates and times in which you are gonna be available for private conversations with language students. They will only be able to send you requests for the dates and times you decide, and never for a conversation longer than 2 hours. What is more, you can also restrict the type of conversation you accept (time banking conversations, paid conversations or any of those).

data.name: HelpSetAvailability10
data.value: How do I change the start time of a block?

data.name: HelpSetAvailability11
data.value: You can drag and drop the blocks over other free slots. If you are using a touchable device, touch and hold before you start dragging

data.name: HelpSetAvailability12
data.value: How do I remove a block?

data.name: HelpSetAvailability13
data.value: Click the block you want to remove and a popover with the option Remove will appear. Click Remove to confirm

data.name: HelpSetAvailability2
data.value: Keeping your availability updated will help you to organize your time as a native speaker and you will avoid the frustration of dealing with contact requests when you're not looking to speak with students. Take into account that if you do not set your availability, you will only be able to make videocalls with your contact list or with other students at the chat rooms

data.name: HelpSetAvailability3
data.value: To set your availability go to My calendar and click Edit Availability at the top, or go directly to Edit availability and follow these steps:

data.name: HelpSetAvailability4
data.value: Select the type of conversation you want to receive requests for by clicking Wallet, Time banking or Both

data.name: HelpSetAvailability5
data.value: Click and drag over any free time slots. (If you are using a touchable device, you will have to touch and hold before you start dragging)

data.name: HelpSetAvailability6
data.value: Repeat previous steps for creating as many blocks as you want

data.name: HelpSetAvailability7
data.value: How do I change the duration of an available block?

data.name: HelpSetAvailability8
data.value: Place your mouse pointer on the block you want to change. Two small lines will appear at the end. Click those lines and drag for resizing the block until it has the duration you want.

data.name: HelpSetAvailability9
data.value: If you are using a touchable device, touch and hold on the block until a small white dot appears at the end of the block. Then touch the dot and drag for resizing the block

data.name: HelpSetAvailabilityTitle
data.value: Set your availability

data.name: HelpSetRate1
data.value: Once you meet the requirements, you can set your rate for charging students for private conversations. To do so, follow the next steps:

data.name: HelpSetRate2
data.value: Open your state panel by clicking on your photo on the top right side of your home screen

data.name: HelpSetRate3
data.value: Go to the Wallet section of the State Panel and look for the language you want to set your rate for

data.name: HelpSetRate4
data.value: Click on the button and the dialog for updating the rate will be shown

data.name: HelpSetRate5
data.value: Set the amount of credits per hour that you want to charge students and click Save

data.name: HelpSetRate6
data.value: Take a moment for checking your state per language. Students will only be able to call you in those languages you set as available. Click on the switchs next to each language to set your state Available/Unavailable

data.name: HelpSetRateTitle
data.value: How do I set my rate?

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners1
data.value: If you're looking for conversation partners (either for timebanking or paid conversations), you should take advantage of Langademy meetups.

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners10
data.value: How do I join a meet up?

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners11
data.value: Just enter the meetup page and click on the Attend button. Take into account that you can only attend meetups of languages that you have in your profile.

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners2
data.value: Meetups are the way you can let everybody know in advance when you will be online in a chat room. This way, students and other native speakers can join you at the same time. Indeed, you can enter a chat room whenever you want but, let's be honest. It's easier to bring together a larger group of people if you schedule an event in advance.

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners3
data.value: Check the Meetups to see already scheduled meetups. If any meetup fits in with your plans, just join in. Otherwise, schedule a new one.

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners4
data.value: When you join a meet up, the event will be added to your calendar and you will be able to write on the message board and propose conversation topics.

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners5
data.value: How do I schedule a new meetup?

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners6
data.value: To schedule a new meetup go to Meetups and click New Meetup on the top side, or go directly to New meetup and follow these steps:

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners7
data.value: Select the language of the meetup. Participants will attend the meetup at the chat room of that language.

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners8
data.value: Select the date and time of the meetup (in your local timezone).

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartners9
data.value: Click Save.

data.name: HelpHowMeetPartnersTitle
data.value: How can I meet partners?

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation1
data.value: When you visit the profile of any user that wants to make language exchanges or just help students practice in exchange of credits, you will see their availability calendars.

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation2
data.value: If you want to request a private conversation, click Request Conversation (on top of the calendar) and follow the steps on screen. You just have to select a conversation language (among the native languages in the profile), the type of conversation you want (timebanking or paid) and reserve the date and time of the conversation clicking on any available block. Green blocks mean you can request a time banking conversation, grey blocks mean that you can request a paid conversation, and yellow blocks mean that the user accepts both. Note that you cannot make a reservation longer than 2 hours.

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation3
data.value: If the user hasn't available hours you will have the option to be notified when he/she is available. Just click the button next to the warning message on top of the calendar if you want to receive it.

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation4
data.value: How do I know if a native accepts my request?

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation5
data.value: You can track the status of your requests in your Conversations page. Check the conversation requests panel (sent). Select the request that you want and you will see the request details view. There you can check if the native accepted or rejected your request, you can cancel it and you can send messages to the native in case you need additional information.

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation6
data.value: Furthermore, when the native accepts your request you will be notified and a new event will be added to your calendar.

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation7
data.value: What do I have to do at the time of the conversation?

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation8
data.value: Go to the call panel and select the Private Conversations Tab . Select the user and you will open the conversation videoapp. Alternatively, you can open the videoapp from the conversation details view in your Conversations.

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversation9
data.value: When you already are in the videoapp you will see when your partner is online, and in the meantime you can write in your private chat to make your partner aware of you being there.

data.name: HelpHowRequestConversationTitle
data.value: How to request a private conversation

data.name: HelpMeetupsTitle
data.value: Meetups

data.name: CompleteProfile
data.value: Complete your profile

data.name: HelpWhatYouCanDoTitle
data.value: What can I do in Langademy?

data.name: HelpHowToBegin
data.value: How to begin

data.name: HelpNativeSpeakers
data.value: Native speakers

data.name: HelpNativesWalletRequirementsTitle
data.value: Requirements for natives to earn money

data.name: HelpStudents
data.value: Students

data.name: HelpWhatYouCanDo1
data.value: Langademy is a social network where students and native speakers can practice languages making video calls. You can choose between two video call modalities: Wallet calls or Time Banking calls.

data.name: HelpWhatYouCanDo2
data.value: In a Wallet call, language students pay natives to have private conversations. If a time banking call is made, time is used as a trade. Check the {0} and the {1} sections for more information about these type of calls.

data.name: HelpChatRooms2
data.value: You can see several areas in the chat room:

data.name: HelpChatRooms3
data.value: Chat area: Write on the text box at the bottom and press enter to send a message

data.name: HelpChatRooms5
data.value: Next meetups: Next meetups scheduled to practice a language in the chat room. See {0} for more info about meetups

data.name: HelpChatRooms6
data.value: Meetup topics: During a meetup it will contain the list of conversation topics proposed by the participants

data.name: HelpHowToCall1
data.value: Starting a call in Langademy is easy. Just find the symbol when you want to make call. Click it to show the call menu to choose the language of the conversation and the call type ( time banking or wallet). In case of wallet calls, the rate you will be charged is showed next to the language.

data.name: HelpHowToCall2
data.value: Note that the language that you choose when you call determines whether you are acting as a native speaker or as a student, and whether the call is paid with time or credits. Therefore, your time or wallet balance will be updated consequently, so pay attention when you make a call.

data.name: HelpHowToCall3
data.value: You can start a video call from different places:

data.name: HelpHowToCall4
data.value: Call from the control panel

data.name: HelpHowToCall41
data.value: Click the tab of the Control Panel to open the Call panel. There, you can select any of the following tabs:

data.name: HelpHowToCall42
data.value: Online contacts: List of contacts currently online

data.name: HelpHowToCall43
data.value: Call history: Users you have recently spoken with

data.name: HelpHowToCall44
data.value: All contacts: The list of your contacts ordered alphabetically

data.name: HelpHowToCall45
data.value: Private conversations: The list of users you have scheduled a private conversation with

data.name: HelpHowToCall5
data.value: Call from a chat room

data.name: HelpHowToCall51
data.value: Go to the Users panel and click the user you want to call to open the Call menu

data.name: HelpHowToCall6
data.value: Call from a user profile

data.name: HelpHowToCall61
data.value: You can only call users from their profiles in case you are contacts. If that is the case, you will have the call button at the bottom right side of the users's cover photo

data.name: HelpHowToCallTitle
data.value: How to make a video call

data.name: HelpWCIntro2
data.value: As a student, you begin purchasing Langademy credits that are deposited in your Wallet account. You spend your credits when you call a native speaker (Level C2 or Native). You will pay for the exact amount of time that you talk but, as an exception, when the call begins, you have 3 minutes to decide if you want to go on with the conversation. In case you hang up, you won't be charged

data.name: HelpWCIntro3
data.value: As a native, you have to set your rate per hour of conversation. You will earn credits with each video call according to its duration. You can set different rates per language.

data.name: HelpWCIntro4
data.value: Note that native speakers cannot start a Wallet call. As students pay for the conversations, they are the ones that are allowed to make calls

data.name: HelpWCIntro5
data.value: You can manage your wallet account from {0} app

data.name: HelpMWTTitle
data.value: My Wallet transactions

data.name: HelpInvoicesTitle
data.value: Langademy invoices

data.name: HelpInvoicingData1
data.value: Select Invoicing Data at My Wallet's main menu to open it. At this page you can:

data.name: HelpInvoicingData2
data.value: Enter your personal data for the invoices issued by Langademy. You must complete this form if you want to earn money at Langademy ({0}). Additionally, your browser will prompt you to allow sharing your location when you fill the form. The country of your invoicing address must be the same as your location.

data.name: HelpInvoicingData3
data.value: Enter the paypal account you want to use for credit withdrawals. Be careful when you complete it! You do not want that Langademy transfers your money to another person!!

data.name: HelpInvoicingDataTitle
data.value: Invoicing data

data.name: HelpMWT1
data.value: Select Transactions at My Wallet's main menu to open your credit transaction history. At this page you can:

data.name: HelpMWT2
data.value: Watch your Available balance

data.name: HelpMWT3
data.value: This is the current amount of credits you can spend at Langademy. Visit {0} for more details

data.name: HelpMWT4
data.value: Watch your transaction history

data.name: HelpMWT5
data.value: Every operation that modifies your credits balance will be included here (e.g. Credit purchases, credits earned and spent making wallet video calls, invoice collections and credit withdrawals)

data.name: HelpPurchaseCredits1
data.value: Select Credit shop at My Wallet's main menu to open the credit purchase page. The purchasing process involves a few simple steps:

data.name: HelpPurchaseCredits2
data.value: Enter the amount of credits you want to purchase.

data.name: HelpPurchaseCredits3
data.value: 1 Langademy credit € = 1 EURO €

data.name: HelpPurchaseCredits4
data.value: Check the minimum credits purchase, which depends on the payment method you select. If your location is available and your country's local currency is not Euro, you may see the estimated conversion to your currency. Note that this conversion is only informative since the final exchange rate is applied by the banking entities.

data.name: HelpPurchaseCredits5
data.value: Select the payment method and follow the steps on screen. You will be redirected to the secure payment gateway to complete the payment

data.name: HelpPurchaseCredits6
data.value: Once you confirm the payment, your wallet balance will be updated and you will be able to use your credits in Langademy

data.name: HelpPurchaseCreditsTitle
data.value: Purchase credits

data.name: HelpInvoices1
data.value: Select Invoices at My Wallet's main menu to open the Langademy invoices page.

data.name: HelpInvoices2
data.value: At this page you can find the invoices issued by Langademy monthly. Note that Langademy only issues an invoice if you have chargeable transactions for the period ({0}). Also note that these invoices only include the Langademy fees for our service, but not payments as a student to native speakers or teachers.

data.name: HelpInvoices3
data.value: Before the monthly invoice is issued you can track your monthly expenses going to {0} and checking the Langademy fee.

data.name: HelpInvoices4
data.value: After a monthly invoice is issued, it will be collected from your wallet account, but never from your credit card or Paypal account.

data.name: HelpInvoices5
data.value: When a monthly invoice is collected you will have a new transaction in your Wallet transaction history and the monthly Langademy fee will be updated.

data.name: HelpTimeBankApp1
data.value: The Time Bank is the app where you can track your timebanking video call history and watch your time balance.

data.name: HelpTimeBankApp2
data.value: You can open the Time Bank clicking the Apps button at the Control Panel and selecting the Time Bank button

data.name: HelpTimeBankApp3
data.value: Each timebanking call will add or subtract time to your time balance according to {0}

data.name: HelpTimeBankAppTitle
data.value: Time Bank

data.name: HelpHTGeoTitle
data.value: How to set geolocation permissions

data.name: HelpHTBrowser
data.value: For the best user experience you should be using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox

data.name: HelpHTGeoChr2
data.value: Find the "Location" section

data.name: HelpHTGeoChr3
data.value: Choose Allow always

data.name: HelpHTGeoChr4
data.value: Close the options panel

data.name: HelpHTGeoClickpadlock
data.value: Click the green padlock at the left of the address bar

data.name: HelpHTGeoFF2
data.value: Find the "Location" warning indicating that the permission is denied

data.name: HelpHTGeoFF3
data.value: Remove it clicking the cross button

data.name: HelpHTGeoFF5
data.value: The browser shows a popup asking for permission to share your location with Langademy

data.name: HelpHTGeoFF6
data.value: Check the "Remember this decision" checkbox and click the Allow access button

data.name: HelpHTGeoRefresh
data.value: Refresh the page
